metadata.dc:author: Martín Rivera, B
Salas Campos, L
metadata.dc:description: Percutaneous tracheostomy using dilatation is a new technique for opening up the trachea whose use has become generalized in intensive care units since this method has numerous advantages over conventional tracheostomy and a lesser number of adverse effects. This article describes a nursing protocol for this technique; it reviews its most frequent complications and it details the nursing care which patients require once they have undergone.
metadata.dc:title: Traqueostomía percutánea.
[Percutaneous tracheostomy].
